thread.title: Lindsay Lohan says she was 'racially profiled' while wearing a headscarf at London airport
thread.title_full: Lindsay Lohan says she was 'racially profiled' while wearing a headscarf at London airport

title: Lindsay Lohan says she was 'racially profiled' while wearing a headscarf at London airport
text:
Lindsay Lohan says she was 'racially profiled' while wearing a headscarf at London airport Published February 21, 2017 
This Oct. 16, 2016 file photo shows actress Lindsay Lohan at the entrance of the Lohan Nightclub during the opening night in Athens, Greece. (AP) 
Lindsay Lohan claims she was "racially profiled" while wearing a headscarf at London's Heathrow Airport. 
The actress said in a new interview that she was stopped while traveling to New York. 
The "Mean Girls" star said an airport worker "opened my passport and saw 'Lindsay Lohan' and started immediately apologizing, but then said: 'Please take off your headscarf.'" 
She said on "Good Morning Britain" Tuesday that the incident made her wonder "how would another woman who doesn't feel comfortable taking off her headscarf feel?" 
Lohan was returning from Turkey, where she recently met President Recep Tayyip Erdogan. A post shared by Lindsay Lohan (@lindsaylohan) on Jan 27, 2017 at 1:53pm PST 
She said she wore a headscarf in Turkey out of "personal respect." 
Lohan, who has been photographed carrying a Quran, says she finds "solace" studying the Muslim holy book and other religious texts. 
The Associated Press contributed to this report. Advertisement
